DOC.brief_summary: To compare safety efficacy two dosage regimen ( daily thrice-weekly ) sulfamethoxazole/trimethoprim ( SMX/TMP ; TMS ) prevention Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia ( PCP ) high-risk HIV-infected patient . Previous test show SMX/TMP give daily effective prevent recurrence PCP may effective prevent PCP patient never develop . Because SMX/TMP cause side effect , study attempt determine safest effective dose combination .
DOC.brief_title: A Randomized , Comparative , Prospective Study Daily Trimethoprim / Sulfamethoxazole ( TMS ) Thrice-Weekly TMS Prophylaxis Against PCP HIV-Infected Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Previous test show SMX/TMP give daily effective prevent recurrence PCP may effective prevent PCP patient never develop . Because SMX/TMP cause side effect , study attempt determine safest effective dose combination . Patients receive SMX/TMP orally daily thrice-weekly basis . Patients clinically evaluate every 4 month . Patients daily SMX/TMP develop drug-related toxicity may switch thrice-weekly SMX/TMP . Duration follow-up 12 month .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Patients must : HIV infection . CD4 count < = 200 cells/mm3 OR history prior PCP . No active pneumocystosis . Patients guardian must sign informed consent .
